title: WordPress H5P plugin doesn't work in Firefox for Ubuntu only
content: Hello, I'm creating a website with Wordpress and I have tested the H5P plugin. But the created exercises are displayed randomly. Sometimes they appear, sometimes they don't. When they appear, if I refresh the page, they disappear ... I am using Firefox version 82.0.3 on Ubuntu 20.04. It's amazing because everything works perfectly with Firefox for Windows and for Android. Where does this display problem come from? How to fix this issue? Here is my test page: https://didakeo.com/article-3/ Thanks for your help !
creator: Blogueur

title: No audio on Firefox.
content: No audio on Firefox. My PC desktop, running on Windows 8.1, plays sounds when I do a sound check and plays sounds on other browsers. It used to play sounds on Firefox until tonight. The lock icon has “Allow Audio and Video” selected. I tried rebooting the computer. Please let me know how to fix this. Thanks

title: Youtube is not functioning on Firefox
content: I've updated my Firefox on yesterday. I found I am unable to see the long toolbar after clicking onto my account icon, what I can see is half a length of the original ones. Also, Youtube always keep on logging me out. I've tried clearing the cookies and history, disable all the add-ons, reset the browser as well as boot Firefox into safe mode but none of these work. Would there still have other solutions available for me?
creator: W.Y.

title: All Firefox shortcuts etc. deleted when I restart Windows
content: I add Firefox to my taskbar and lock the taskbar. I pin Firefox to my Start menu. I put a shortcut to Firefox on my desktop. I have even created a new folder on my desktop with a different name and made the contents "read only". I have made Firefox my default Web browser. No matter what I do - if I restart this laptop all of the above goes away. All Firefox appearances disappear. A couple days ago, Firefox even disappeared from my Start menu list of all programs. It's still installed, but I have to navigate to its location to open it. What else can I do? Is Microsoft doing this on purpose?
creator: dliquin

title: Firefox opens previous tabs on startup even though this setting is turned off
content: Whenever I open Firefox it opens a new tab for a brief moment then closes it and opens my previous tabs from my last session. I have this setting unchecked in the settings. I think that it is crashing and trying to restore my pages because of that, but there are no crash reports when I visit about:crash. I am running the latest version of Firefox and windows 10.
creator: Sluke950

title: Send Tab from Firefox desktop to android devices doesn't work properly
content:
I tried to use "Send tab to device" function between my Windows and Android phone. When I sent a tab from android device to PC, the new tab opened on PC immediately. But if I tried to send a tab from PC to android device, I couldn't get notification on my phone. New tabs ONLY appears when I tapped the "sync now" button mannually(see following picture), in fact I saw my account synced automatically on android every few minutes without any issue.

I use Firefox international account in China, the synchronization process is a bit slow, but it still works fine, so I don't why this "send tab to android device" function doesn't work normally? Note:Most of the time, I use cellular network on my phone.
creator: wuxiaohuaer1
